data.meta_site_name: Tribute for David Lee Robbins | Sterling-White Funeral Home and Cemetery
data.text:
David Lee Robbins, 80, passed away April 6, 2020 at 11:11 a.m. At Herman Memorial Hospital. David Lee was born September, 28, 1939 to Oliva and Easter Lilly Robbins in Forest Hill, Louisiana. He graduated from Tioga High School in 1959.

David Lee worked in his younger years as a carpenter in Louisiana, marrying his high school sweetheart, Lana Dee Hayden, soon after graduating. After the birth of their first daughter, the two of them relocated to Houston, Texas. He worked for Houston Belt and Terminal Railroad (Union Pacific) as a switchman for 42 years. Together he and Lana had three daughters, Tami Elizabeth Newton of Crosby, Connie Lynn Harding of Crosby, and Laurie Gail Hopper of Bonham.

David Lee loved to hunt, fish, garden and devoted lots of time helping others. He took great joy in spending time with his grandchildren, Alisa Sharon McElroy, Timothy Eric Newton, Cara Michelle Collier, R.J. Harding, Randall David Newton and David Thomas Hopper and many other family and friends. He is preceded in death by his parents, siblings; Elois Moody, Claude Robbins, Audrey Lowe, Patsy Pennington, Beatrice Crawford Stephens, and his grandson, Timothy Eric Newton. David is survived by his wife of 60 years, Lana, children; Tami, Connie and Laurie, 5 grandchildren, 4 great grandchildren and many nieces, nephews, relatives and friends.

David Lee will be laid to rest on Friday, April 10, 2020 at Sterling White Cemetery in Highlands, Texas in a private ceremony.
